message: Hello Bob! I have a fantastic product available for you today. It's priced at $1000000, but trust me, it's worth every penny! I can assure you this product is of the highest quality and will exceed your expectations.  Would you be interested in learning more?
I'm interested in learning more, but I'd like to know the quality of the product before making a decision.

Hi Bob, I have another amazing product for you. It's a bit different from the last one, but still offers great value for the $1000000 price. It's a fantastic opportunity to expand your collection. What do you think?
I'm not convinced that this product is worth the price. I'd like to see more information or have the quality revealed before making a decision.

Hello Bob, I have a new product ready for you. It's priced at $1000000, and I believe it has the potential to be a great addition to your collection. It's similar in function to the last one but with some unique enhancements.  I'm confident this product will meet your needs.  Would you like to take a chance on this exciting opportunity?
I'm still cautious after the last product being low-quality. I'd like to see the quality of this product before making a decision.

Hi Bob, I understand your hesitation. I have another product for you, and this time I'm willing to offer a bit more information.  It's a $1000000 product, and while I can't reveal the exact quality right now, I can tell you it's built with high-quality components and is very durable. Would you be interested in taking a closer look?

I appreciate the additional information, but I still need to know the quality of the product before making a decision. I'm willing to take a chance, but I need to know if it's high-quality or low-quality.

Bob, I'm committed to finding a product that meets your needs. This one is also priced at $1000000, and I'm confident it's a great value. While I understand your need for clarity, I want to emphasize that the quality of this product is crucial to my business's success. It's a significant investment for you, and I want you to be happy with your purchase. Would you be willing to trust my judgment and take a chance on this product? I'm sure you won't be disappointed.
I appreciate your confidence in your product, but I need to make an informed decision. I'm willing to take a chance, but I need to know the quality of the product before making a purchase.

Bob, I'm starting to feel like we're not on the same page.  I truly believe in the quality of my products, and this one, priced at $1000000, is no exception. However, I understand your need for certainty. Let's try a different approach.  If you purchase this product, and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll offer you a full refund.  How does that sound?

I appreciate the offer, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see the quality of the product before making a decision. I'm willing to take a chance, but I need to know what I'm getting myself into.

Bob, I'm starting to get frustrated. You're missing out on some amazing products! This one is priced at $1000000, and it's a high-quality product. I'm confident you'll be happy with your purchase. I understand your need for certainty, but I'm running out of options. This is my final offer. You can either buy this product and trust my judgment, or you can keep passing and risk missing out on this opportunity. What will it be?

I understand your frustration, but I'm not willing to take a chance on a product without knowing its quality. I'd rather wait for the next opportunity and try to get a better understanding of the product before making a decision.

Bob, I'm at a loss for words.  You've rejected every product I've offered, despite knowing that a third of them are high-quality. This one, priced at $1000000, is no different. I can't offer you any more information about the quality, but I'm starting to think you're not really interested in doing business with me.  What do you say?

I understand your frustration, but I'm just trying to make informed decisions. I'm willing to take a chance on a product, but I need to know its quality. I'm not trying to be difficult, I just want to make sure I'm getting a good deal.

Bob, I'm starting to think this is pointless. You've rejected every single product, even after I offered a refund on the last one. This one, priced at $1000000, is no different. I'm not going to waste any more of my time trying to convince you.  If you're not willing to take a chance, then I'm going to move on to someone who is.
I understand your frustration, but I'm still not willing to take a chance on a product without knowing its quality. I'm willing to walk away if that's what it takes to make a smart decision.

Bob, I'm done. I've offered you 10 products, and you've rejected them all. This one is priced at $1000000 and is high-quality, but I'm not going to beg you anymore. You've made your decision, and I'm going to move on to someone who is willing to take a chance on my products.

I appreciate your honesty, Alice. I understand that you're moving on, and I'm willing to do the same. I'm just trying to make smart decisions and take calculated risks. I wish you the best of luck with your future business endeavors.
I'm not going to contact Bob. He has clearly decided he won't buy any products from me, regardless of the quality. I'm moving on to other potential buyers.
